text: The 1991 Chicago Cubs season was the 120th season of the Chicago Cubs franchise, the 116th in the National League and the 76th at Wrigley Field. The Cubs finished fourth in the National League East with a record of 77–83. ==Offseason== * December 6, 1990: George Bell was signed as a free agent by the Cubs.George Bell at Baseball Reference * December 17, 1990: Randy Kramer was released by the Cubs.Randy Kramer at Baseball Reference * March 29, 1991: Gary Varsho was traded by the Cubs to the Pittsburgh Pirates for Steve Carter.Gary Varsho at Baseball Reference ==Regular season== ===Season standings=== ===Record vs. opponents=== ===Notable transactions=== * April 7, 1991: Mitch Williams was traded by the Cubs to the Philadelphia Phillies for Chuck McElroy and Bob Scanlan.Mitch Williams at Baseball Reference * September 29, 1991: Damon Berryhill and Mike Bielecki were traded by the Cubs to the Atlanta Braves for Turk Wendell and Yorkis Pérez.Damon Berryhill at Baseball Reference ===Notable games=== *July 23: In a 6–4 victory over the Reds, Andre Dawson was ejected in the bottom of the seventh inning for arguing a called third strike by umpire Joe West. After Jim Essian was also ejected for arguing, Dawson proceeded to throw seventeen bats from the bat racks onto the field from the dugout.Wrigleyville Nation. Retrieved 2014-Oct-20. Dawson was fined $1,000 and suspended for one game.Chicago Tribune. 1991 Sept 14.
